In this study, self-adaptive step tangent optimization (SASTO) algorithm is proposed and applied to optimize new energy enterprises’ corporate performance. The result shows SASTO can effectively improve the prediction effectiveness and efficiency of the model.
Authors: Wang, Tian and Lin, Jianbang

Title: A New Modeling of Cooperative Agents from Game-Theoretic Perspective
Abstract: Coalitional game theory offers a theoretical framework for agent cooperation in Distributed Artificial Intelligence (DAI). A critical issue in coalitional games is the formation of coalitions, which depends closely on players' payoffs, viz., players' preferences. In this work, we consider the reason of players' preferences in coalitional games. We propose a refined modelling of coalition games by incorporating a priority structure called priority graph. Priority graphs encode the features of game choices and their priority (or weight), from which players' preferences can be induced. A new definition of the solution core for coalitional games is proposed. The dynamics of the priority structure for players and its influence on players' preferences are also studied.
Authors: Liu, Chanjuan and Zhu, Enqiang
Keywords: Coalition formation, Coalitional games, Artificial intelligence, Payoffs

Title: Post-Laryngectomy Interaction Restoration System
Abstract: Laryngectomy is a surgical treatment that leads to voice loss. Novel approach to regaining communicative function after the operation is presented. In contrast to most technologies using artificial intelligence to restore the voice, it focuses on balancing the use of technology with human compensatory capabilities. A design process that consists of first person participatory design and user interviews is presented. In the current phase proposed device integrates wearable vibrating effector with voice pitch controller and voice amplifying set and dynamical voice conversion system, adding personal traits to the speech signal.
Authors: Zieli\'{n}ski, Konrad and Szamburski, Ryszard and Machnacz, Ewa
Keywords: laryngectomy, voice conversion, human-machine interaction, participatory design, assistive technologies

Title: A Study on The Admission Policy of College Entrance Examination for Ethnic Minorities in China from the Perspective of Cultural Analysis
Abstract: The preferential policy of College Entrance Examination for Ethnic Minorities in China is an important measure taken by the state to improve the educational development level of ethnic minorities and promote the healthy development of higher education of ethnic minorities. It is committed to promoting the economic, cultural and social development of ethnic minorities with educational equality as its value orientation. The purpose of this study is to deepen the theoretical system of the national ethnic education policy and promote the implementation and improvement of the policy. This paper makes statistics on the implementation of this policy. Based on the logic of cultural analysis framework, this paper analyzes the practical challenges faced by the policy from three aspects: value orientation, cultural environment and cognition. This paper try to improve the policy from the two aspects of the social values and operating mechanism.
Authors: Xiaofang, Chen and Ping, Xue
Keywords: Higher education, Ethnic minorities, Admission policy, Education fair

Title: Student Travel Award Recipients for the 2014 AAAI/SIGAI Doctoral Consortium
Abstract: AAAI and SIGAI annually co-organize the AAAI/ SIGAI Doctoral Consortium. The Doctoral Consortium (DC) provides an opportunity for a group of Ph.D. students to discuss and explore their research interests and career objectives with a panel of established researchers in artificial intelligence. SIGAI provides travel funding to support students from institutions outside the U.S., while the NSF provides funding for U.S. students. This year, SIGAI supported four international students to attend and present at the 19th AAAI/SIGAI Doctoral Consortium. These students provided testimonials reporting on their experiences at the DC.
Authors: Brys, Tim and Doucette, John and Khazaei, Taraneh and Taig, Ran

Title: On the Formalisation of Kolmogorov Complexity
Abstract: Kolmogorov complexity is an essential tool in the study of algorithmic information theory, and is used in the fields of Artificial Intelligence, cryptography, and coding theory. The formalisation of the theorems of Kolmogorov complexity is also key to proving results in the theory of Intelligent Agents, specifically the results in Universal Artificial Intelligence. In this paper, we present a mechanisation of some of these fundamental results. In particular, building on HOL4's existing model of computability, we provide a formal definition of the complexity of a binary string, and then prove (i) that Kolmogorov complexity is uncomputable; (ii) the Kolmogorov Complexity invariance theorem; (iii) the Kraft and Kolmogorov-Kraft inequalities; and (iv) key Kolmogorov Complexity inequalities.
Authors: Catt, Elliot and Norrish, Michael
Keywords: Interactive Proof Systems, Computability, Kolmogorov Complexity

Title: Research on the Application of Fall Detection Technology Based on the Security Field of the Smart Care for the Elderly
Abstract: Abstract. The security of the elderly in an aging society has become a social problem attracting much attention, among which the problem of secondary injury caused by the fall has attracted wide concern of researchers. The application of fall detection combined with artificial intelligence technology has become an important application in the security field of smart care for the elderly. After analyzing and judging the human body features, this paper found out that the combination of human skeleton and fall detection technology could be used to identify the fall behavior and link it with the alarm system to solve the security problem of smart care for the elderly. The experimental results showed that the recognition rate of fall detection was increased by 2% after adding optimization of genetic algorithm factors and contrast calculation of prediction frame length in the process of human feature target detection.
Authors: Chen, Zhiwen and Ji, Yong and Ren, Yuanhong
Keywords: Keywords. Smart Care for the Elderly, Fall Detection, Human Features, Genetic Algorithm

Title: Effect of Confidence Indicators on Trust in AI-Generated Profiles
Abstract: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is increasingly augmenting and generating online content, but research suggests that users distrust content which they believe to be AI-generated. In this paper, we study whether introducing a confidence indicator, a text rating of an algorithm's confidence in its source data alongside rationale for why the data is more or less trustworthy, affects this distrust in Airbnb host profiles believed to be computer-generated. Our results indicate that a low-confidence indicator decreases participant trust in the rental host, but high-confidence indicators have no significant impact on trust. These findings suggest that user trust of AI-generated content can be negatively, but not positively, affected by a confidence indicator.
Authors: Bruzzese, Tommy and Gao, Irena and Dietz, Griffin and Ding, Christina and Romanos, Alyssa
Keywords: artificial intelligence-mediated communication (AI-MC), trust, artificial intelligence, computer-mediated communication (CMC)

Title: Research on Informatization Education Methods under the Background of Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: Higher education reform has entered a critical period, while the impact of artificial intelligence on higher education is also deepening. This paper studies the internal elements of higher education in this context: the development and reform of higher education education forms, curriculum construction and planning, classroom teaching forms, teacher- student relations, class organization and management, etc.; discusses the development and transformation of artificial intelligence from national strategic planning The process of moving towards higher education practice; seeking reform paths for higher education, management, teaching and artificial intelligence technology and social changes in the new era.
Authors: Zhufeng, Ye and Sitthiworachart, Jirarat

Title: Using Artificial Intelligence-based Online Translation Website to improve the Health Education in International Students
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to test the feasibility of using AI-based online translation tools in health management education to determine its effect on improving health management education. Several of the current mainstream online translation tools for translating English literature related to health management education have been tested. The knowledge of health management translated by the online translation tool is translated into the mother tongue for the evaluation of the students’ cognitive ability of the relevant knowledge. The online questionnaire was used to provide feedback on students’ understanding and mastery of health management knowledge translated into their native language. The mainstream online translation tools already allow students to translate basic health education materials into their native language. The mainstream translation tools with the assistance of artificial intelligence can achieve high accuracy in the translation of short sentences in health education materials. The results show that the online translation of health education materials from non-native language to native language can basically enable students to obtain the correct understanding of health education materials. Of course, converting long sentences in health education materials into short sentences to improve the accuracy of intelligent translation tools can effectively improve the cognitive effect. Future research could further validate the AI-assisted learning of health education materials in non-native languages.
Authors: Jiang, Tao and Li, Wenqin and Wang, Jiashu and Wang, Xinguo

Title: Applying Artificial Intelligence to Primary and Secondary School Physical Education
Abstract: The physical education curriculum reform has been fruitful since the founding of New China, however, the physical education curriculum reform has long neglected the combination with the latest technology and has not broken through the education approach based on physical education and health curriculum. Since the birth of artificial intelligence education, it has provided a solution to break through the limitation of distance and teachers’ resources, and the combination of artificial intelligence education and the physical education curriculum is an important direction to deepen the physical education curriculum reform. The simplified application of "human-computer learning symbiosis" breaks through the current dilemma of insufficient technological power and AI education theory, and helps the application of AI education in the physical education curriculum. It has the application advantages of human-oriented and personalized teaching; promoting the formation of lifelong sports concepts; cultivating higher-order thinking ability; and promoting the development of the sports industry.
Authors: He, Zhewei and Niu, Xiaohong

Title: Search for a New Paradigm of Education and Artificial Intelligence. Place and Role of Artificial Intelligence in the New Education System
Abstract: Humanity is on the cusp of the fourth industrial revolution. Cardinal changes are expected in all spheres of human activity, including the education system. A global reform of education is expected, which will lead to a change in its very paradigma, the creation of a new teaching methodology, a change in the forms and methods of teaching, and the creation of new teaching methods. But in this direction there are many difficulties and unsolved scientific problems. For example, there is no clear idea of what the “paradigm of education” is, how it is related to the teaching methodology, and the ways of transforming the education system are not defined. The paper considers new models of the use of information technologies in teaching, defines the place and role of artificial intelligence in the new education system.
Authors: Vostroknutov, Igor and Grigoriev, Sergey and Surat, Lev

Title: Practice and Exploration of Artificial Intelligence Education in Chinese Universities Based on the STEAM Concept
Abstract: At present, China's emerging technologies enjoy vigorous development, and emerging industrial chain with artificial intelligence and big data as the mainstay has dominated China's new economic form. With it, the question of how to cultivate innovative and compound talents in emerging disciplines has become one core difficulty in the current higher education. The highly interdisciplinary integrated STEAM education is suitable for the initial training of new talents. This paper studies the status quo of STEAM education and artificial intelligence education in Chinese universities. Based on the practice of STEAM talent training in Anshan Normal University, it combines artificial intelligence-related education practice, tracks and analyzes various indicators of students in STEAM course to explore the feasibility plan for artificial intelligence education in Chinese universities.
Authors: Xu, Qingyang and Zhi, Ying and Qi, Zhonghua and Wen, Xiaoli

Title: Artificial Intelligence and Higher Education Institutions
Abstract: Modern education scenario has led to the emergence of varied challenges in the form of an altered approach of students towards learning and related avenues. The tendency of the current generation students to seek ease in everything they do and to cater to their inclination towards receiving quick responses and rescues to their needs, has opened up newer horizons of opportunities in the education sector too. In line with the imprints of technology based shift in education sector, resorting to an adaptive learning environment, powered by application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to the education system seems to bring about turn-around alterations. The present paper’s aim is to explore the prospective advantages of application of AI to the Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) , in terms of the associated stakeholders, viz., Students, Educators as well as Parents. An effort has been made to provide an insight into the vast prospective avenues of Artificial Intelligence in the education sector.
Authors: Agarwal, Nimmi and Kumar, Saumya and Anand, Sandeep Kumar and Dharwal, Mridul and Vatsa, Madhuranjan

Title: A long term impact of artificial intelligence and robotics on higher education
Abstract: Artificial intelligence and robotics are expected to substantially impact higher education (HE). Due to the fragmented literature and evolving definitions of terminology, it is impossible to determine the extent of its effect. In terms of technical feasibility and educational or societal benefit, these modifications are controversial. To better understand and examine the potential of AI and robotics, imagine what they could look like in the future. A thorough narrative literature review was conducted to identify eight design roles representing AI and robots' potential in education, administration, and research. Higher-order skills training, teacher obligations, and the effect of human agency and datafication are all raised by these concerns.
Authors: Sharma, A K and Pareta, Avikant and Meena, Jitender and Sharma, Rupak

Title: Implementation of Knowledge Management with Artificial Intelligence in Higher Education
Abstract: Researchers and Academicians have claimed that the development and use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) based Knowledge Management (KM) systems has significant potential and possibilities to improve the higher education systems and procedures than any other advances in technical industries. Many studies have shown that the education sector has been lacking the use of AI and KM systems and that is badly hitting many areas of academic researches and mostly the multidisciplinary and interdisciplinary researches. In this work various machine learning algorithms have been applied with different models. The performances of these models are measured on respective criteria. The results highlight some common but largely hidden facts about lack of mature smart systems in higher education and researches, their impacts, and future of AI based KM systems in education sector.
Authors: Galgotia, Dhruv and Lakshmi, Nirupa

Title: Student Perceptions on Artificial Intelligence (AI) in higher education
Abstract: This purpose of this study was to understand the student perceptions on the usage of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in higher education. AI could form part of higher education in multiple ways whether it be in the Teaching Learning process, Admission process, the Placement process or the Administrative process. The paper brings out the student perceptions on AI usage in business schools from those enrolled in full time program in business management. Online questioner was used to collect both quantitative and qualitative response. Data was collected from 682 student and statistical analysis have been used for arriving at conclusions. Ordination regression and correlation have been used for analysis of the data collect. The qualitative response was helpful to get the views that students have. The results indicate that student have a perception that AI can be effectively used in teaching learning process, academic administration processes, and should not be used in a few processes related to admission, examination and placements.
Authors: Ravi Kumar, V V and Raman, Ramakrishnan

Title: The Development of Students' Computational Thinking Practices in AI Course Using the Game-Based Learning: A Case Study
Abstract: Promoting the computational thinking of the K12 students through artificial intelligence education is reflected in curriculum standards and academic research. Game-based learning promotes the learning interest and motivation, helps students reinforce computational thinking practices. Based on the input-process-result (IPO) game-based learning model, this study integrated the artificial intelligence instructional content, game-based learning, and the core elements of computational thinking practice to design game-based learning activities that was suitable for promoting computational thinking practices in artificial intelligence courses. In this research, the artificial intelligence course “Challenging Tic-Tac-Toe” was conduct in senior high school. The results showed that the game-based learning in artificial intelligence courses could help students to master artificial intelligence subject knowledge, significantly improved the computational thinking practices, enhanced learning interest, motivation, self-confidence, and reduce cognitive load. Thus, this study provides additional evidence that using the game-based learning strategies is an effective learning method that improves both learning performance and computational thinking practices.
Authors: Ma, Jingsi and Zhang, Yi and Bin, Hesiqi and Wang, Kang and Liu, Jinfang and Gao, Hanrui

Title: An Object-Oriented Approach to Ontology Modelling in Specialists Education of Methods and Technologies of Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: Training highly qualified specialists in modern digital and information technologies, including artificial intelligence (AI) methods and technologies tasks Higher educational institutions. Since the 2021/2022 academic year, a new educational program, "Artificial Intelligence", has been introduced at the Department of Applied Mathematics and Artificial Intelligence of the NRU "MPEI" when studying for a master's degree in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science. In new academic disciplines, "Applied Intelligent Systems" (AIS) and "Intelligent Decision Support Systems", students learn and acquire practical skills and competencies in AI models and methods and implement prototypes of modern AI systems for various purposes.
Authors: Eremeev, A. P. and Paniavin, N. A. and Marenkov, M. A.

Title: Prospects for the Use of Artificial Intelligence Technologies in Education
Abstract: The article presents the results of a study devoted to the analysis of the proliferation activity of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies in higher education and the reasons that interfere with this process. The results of a questionnaire survey of employees and leaders of educational organizations in relation to the prospects for the use of artificial intelligence. It has been proven that technical universities and universities - “leaders” are more active and more successful in introducing AI into the educational process. The proliferation of AI in the education organizations is most influenced by the presence of a critical mass of employees with the appropriate competencies. There is a dissimilarity in forecasts about the prospects for the introduction of AI in the groups of universities leading and not so successful. Introductio
Authors: Zharova, Marina V. and Trapitsin, Sergey Yu. and Timchenko, Victor V.

Title: Methodological Aspects of Propaedeutics of Studying Artificial Intelligence by Medical Students
Abstract: The necessity of mastering the basics of artificial intelligence for specialists in various fields today is beyond doubt. The article substantiates the importance of propaedeutic acquaintance with the achievements in the field of activity chosen by students, in particular, in medicine. The methodological features and approximate content of such a lesson are considered, it is emphasized that students have the necessary knowledge base for the successful assimilation of the material.
Authors: Rusakova, Vera and Rusakov, Alexander and Savateeva, Ekaterina

Title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a computerized decision aid for selection of candidates in higher education
Abstract: This paper studies the usage of Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a computerized decision aid in the field of higher education for the selection of candidates to an MBA program of a Business School from a large pool of candidates. The paper brings out as to how AI as a decision aid tool can improve the speed and quality of the selection of candidates for a postgraduate program in Business Management by simplifying the processes. Usage of AI in the admission process to a Business School has been a pioneering effort and this paper captures this process and its benefits uniquely since there is no research available to capture the usage of AI in candidate selection. The paper compares the admission process of two years – in the year 2020 using the traditional approach and in the year 2021 using AI as a computerized decision-making aid. The results of this comparative study clearly demonstrate the superiority of AI as a computerized tool assisting in decision making for the selection of the candidates thereby leading to process improvement.
Authors: Ravi Kumar, V V and Raman, Ramakrishnan

Title: Introduction of Artificial Intelligence as the Basis of Modern Online Education on the Example of Higher Education
Abstract: The article deals with the process of awareness and acceptance of artificial intelligence in the educational process of higher education during the quarantine period. The state of the teacher is considered through the prism of the model of stages of experiencing grief by E. Kubler-Ross. This demonstrates the diversity and complexity of the transition to distance (online) learning. The genesis of the development and the role of information technologies based on artificial intelligence in education at the present stage is determined. Based on research by D. Tatar, J. Roschelle, P. Vahey, W. R. Penuel determined that the highest peak of the development of artificial intelligence and its active implementation in educational technologies refers to the period from 1999 to 2019. The authors highlight the approaches of informatization of the university. The Abai KazNPU has defined a way to build up the integrated digital management system of the university through the univer system. Artificial intelligence programs are highlighted: adaptive and personalized learning, automatic assessment, intermediate learning interval, chatbot, virtual assistants, proctoring and gamification. The authors analyze their own experience of implementing and further actively using artificial intelligence techniques and technologies using the Google Classroom, Kahoot, and Lingualeo platforms in the teaching process. The article presents the results of a survey among the university teaching staff to identify the degree of job satisfaction in the conditions of distance learning. The results of the survey for the autumn half-year of 2020-2021 showed that artificial intelligence is becoming a full-fledged participant in the educational process and occupies a central place in the process of intellectualization of society and the development of the education system as a whole. The progress and technological effectiveness of this process cannot be stopped. It was decided to introduce the elective discipline "Artificial Intelligence" at the bachelor's and master's level, with the continuity of the formed competencies for advanced training in artificial intelligence in the field of educational technologies.
Authors: Syzdykbayeva, Aigul and Baikulova, Aigerim and Kerimbayeva, Rysty

Title: Research on the Level Test Application System of Computer Artificial Intelligence Technology in English Education
Abstract: Based on computer artificial intelligence technology, this paper designs an online automatic evaluation and correction system for higher vocational English based on the combination of C/S mode and B/S mode. This paper firstly designs the functional requirements of the system. The design of the system implementation plan adopts the C/S mode to realize the evaluation and reform. The system implements the English online test process according to the scale of the higher vocational English test and the test requirements and through modules such as group test management, score management, and online test. In this paper, the genetic algorithm is used to determine the optimal solution of the test papers. The system has the advantages of high utilization of network resources, flexible deployment and convenient updating. The simulation results show that the online testing system for higher vocational English education can improve students' English level, especially to cultivate students' online reading habits and help students to correct pronunciation and intonation.
Authors: Dan, Chen

Title: Study on the Application of Artificial Intelligence Technology in Empowering Education : Taking "Intelligent Learning Partner" as an Example
Abstract: With the rapid development of artificial intelligence technology, society has entered an era where artificial intelligence is integrated with all aspects of life, and the impact of artificial intelligence on education has attracted more attention. How does artificial intelligence technology development and what are key technologies integrated with education? And its current development status in the field of education. This article takes the "Smart Learning Partner", an educational product that integrates several number of smart technologies from the Beijing Normal University Future Education Advanced Innovation Center, as an example, and its three application cases in teaching practice: 1. Hybrid based on "Smart Learning Partner" The exploration and analysis of the model teaching model, 2. "Smart Study Partner " to promote the exploration of the precision teaching of junior high school history, 3. The construction and application model research of the discipline ability development evaluation learning and teaching system.
Authors: Li, Xinglong and Ma, ZhiHeng and Tu, Yujuan and Du, YinShi

Title: New Requirements of Teacher Professionalization for Emotional Labor and Psychological Capital in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: Under the function of learning, research, politics and so on, the development of artificial intelligence education is very rapid. Artificial intelligence makes education precision further realized, which also puts forward new requirements for teachers’ specialization. Based on the relationship between education and traditional education in the era of artificial intelligence, this paper studies the strategies and high psychological capital that teachers need to have emotional labor, and puts forward some relevant suggestions, so that teachers can adapt to the new needs of this intelligent era.
Authors: Jiao, Jin

Title: Practical Research on Blended Teaching in Higher Vocational Institutes based on ICVE Platform : —Take Artificial Intelligence Data Processing Course as an Example
Abstract: Based on ICVE platform, taking artificial intelligence data processing course as an example, this paper explores and practices blended teaching. Firstly, the course teaching design is carried out based on the working process, and then according to the requirements of the course and the characteristics of higher vocational institute students, the teaching practice of online and offline, theory and practice is carried out through three parts: before class , in class and after class practice. The survey results show that the blended teaching model has a positive impact on improving higher vocational institute students' learning interest and effect.
Authors: Wang, Jing

Title: Proposed Artificial Intelligence Algorithm for Developing Higher Education
Abstract: Higher education has delved into a new stage of rapid development focusing on quality improvement, while encountering new challenges and obstacles. In this research work, an artificial intelligence algorithm for education improvement is proposed. Firstly, deep feature abstraction in temporal and special dimensions is performed using Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) artificial neural network and convolutional networks. Consequently, multiscale attention fusion techniques are used to improve the articulateness of the characteristic and comeup with better recommendations with the assistance of multilayer perceptron. Moreover, the proposed model helps in improving the cognitive capability of students and enhances their overall quality of perception. Moreover, it has been proven that the performance of the proposed model provides better recommendation outcomes and better robustness compared to existing models through conducting extensive experiments based on real data.
Authors: Al Ka'bi, Amin

Title: Artificial Intelligence Technology in the Development of a Mobile Application for Higher Education Institution Information Portal
Abstract: The article describes the technology of artificial intelligence for the mobile application of the information portal of higher education institution. Artificial intelligence technology is integrated into the university mobile application. A mobile application and an algorithm for user interaction with the mobile application with artificial intelligence are developed. The proposed idea is used in a mobile application of the GPA YALTA Portal.
Authors: Gallini, Nadezhda I. and Kamornitskiy, Daniil T. and Denisenko, Alexander A. and Chetyrbok, Petr V. and Linnik, Ivan I. and Rabosh, Ivan I.

Title: The transformation of artificial intelligence in the 5G era and the impact on education
Abstract: This paper summarizes the development of artificial intelligence and 5G technology in China in recent years, analyzes the changes of artificial intelligence technology in various fields under the background of 5G,and discusses the impact of “5G + AI” on higher education. In recent years, China's artificial intelligence and 5G technology have developed rapidly, and the deep integration of the two is an inevitable trend.which has an important impact on the social economy and various fields of life. With the support of 5G technology, the intelligence of consumption, transportation, tourism, medical care,education and other fields has been further improved. Among them.in the field of higher education, the integration of “5G+AI”has contributed to the construction of the “smart education” environment,the update of the training model.and the innovation of teaching models and learning methods.
Authors: Xiaoling, Pan and Xuan, Zhou

Title: Artificial Intelligence in Legal Education under the Background of Big Data Computation
Abstract: The purpose of legal education is to cultivate professional legal talents, let them master the framework of the current legal system, use legal reasoning, and solve practical problems according to legal logic. In the context of big data (BD), artificial intelligence (AI) technology helps collect a large amount of information and process the information centrally, making the calculation process much simpler. Therefore, we apply AI to the education industry, design a law teaching system based on AI, and conduct a teaching effect test experiment. The experiment shows that the average grade of the class using the artificial intelligence system for law teaching is higher than that of the class using the traditional teaching method, and the grades increase faster, verifying the feasibility of the artificial intelligence teaching system in legal education.
Authors: Ma, Li

Title: Exploring the Technology and Problems of Artificial Intelligence Education Applications
Abstract: The rapid development of artificial intelligence technology and its use in the field of education continues to spread, bringing about high speed development in education. However, there are inevitably some problems in the actual use of AI in education (e.g., simplifying and narrowing it down). Analyze and discuss the problems in the process of using the common techniques of AI educational applications: the problem of simplicity of execution leading to behaviorism, the problem of information cocoon caused by algorithmic recommendations, the problem of teachers' AI anxiety, the problem of ethics of AI educational applications, and the problem of emotional deficiency. The only way to better integrate technology into educational practice is to view it correctly and to grasp the degree of its use.
Authors: Zhang, Kunhong and Deng, Peng

Title: The Integration Development of Artificial Intelligence and Education
Abstract: With the rapid progress and development of modern information science and technology, artificial intelligence technology has become more and more extensive in many fields. How to incorporate artificial intelligence into education has become a hot topic of the whole society. In this paper, analysis of artificial intelligence used to extract application potential and value of intelligent correction, real-time monitoring, education fairness and campus safety. But there are also challenges in personality education, safety ethics, teaching efficiency, etc. In order to make artificial intelligence better serve the education industry, it is necessary to increase the infrastructure construction and environment configuration of artificial intelligence equipment. And then improving the education practitioners’ awareness and correct cognition of the relationship between intelligent machine safety ethics and artificial intelligence.
Authors: Li, Yan and Li, Shaohua and Wang, Longge

Title: System Dynamics-Based Analysis on Factors Influencing Artificial Intelligence Talents Training
Abstract: There are gaps between education supply and industrial demand of talents in intelligent era. Thus, the shortage of artificial intelligence(AI) talents becomes the top challenges facing China’s companies. Hence it is essential to implement educational reform to improve quality of education supply talents. However, educational reform is affected by multiple and intertwined factors. This research, therefore, developed a system dynamics-based model of education reform to sort out relationships among all factors and predict the influence of several factors on AI talents output. Then, based on this model, series of experiments are carried out to find main factors affecting cultivation of AI talents. Results show that: 1)this model could accurately simulate trends of output ratio AI talents under different educational reform measures; 2) Measures including teaching mode reform, improving the application rate of new teaching model, speeding up the construction of new disciplines in higher education, developing AI, improving ethics of AI, and strengthening the integration of AI and education could play significant roles in promoting cultivation of AI talents.
Authors: Jing, Sifeng and Liu, Xiwei and Gong, Xiaoyan and Zhao, Hongxia

Title: A Study on the Construction of Wisdom Classroom for Oral English Course in Higher Vocational College Based on Big Data and Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: With the development of the internationalization of the world economy, English is also playing a very important role in the field of today's disciplines. The innovation of artificial intelligence and information technology makes the university education change obviously. In the future English teaching, colleges and universities should integrate computer application technology and tools into the teaching process of English courses, which provides a huge material and information basis for enhancing students' English social communication ability and English subject literacy ability. Therefore, this paper takes the construction of wisdom classroom as the starting point, fully discusses the concept, construction conditions and functions of wisdom classroom. On this basis, this paper takes civil aviation professional oral English as an example to explore the construction path of oral English wisdom classroom in higher vocational colleges under the background of big data and artificial intelligence, so as to provide reform ideas for the teaching development of higher vocational English.
Authors: Cui, Limin

Title: Comprehensive evaluation algorithm of English online teaching quality based on Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: In view of the complex changing characteristics of English teaching quality, in order to obtain high-precision English teaching quality evaluation results, an English teaching quality evaluation algorithm based on principal component analysis and artificial intelligence is designed. This paper constructs the influence index of English teaching quality, optimizes and selects the evaluation index of English teaching quality by principal component analysis, and obtains the evaluation result of English teaching quality grade by artificial intelligence. The test results of specific application examples show that the proposed evaluation algorithm can accurately evaluate the English teaching quality level, and the evaluation results can provide valuable information for improving the quality of English teachig.
Authors: Lei, Yuqing and Zhang, Xinzhe

Title: On the Innovation of Blended Teaching Mode of New Engineering Based on “Artificial Intelligence +”
Abstract: The rapid rise and wide application of emerging information technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI), big data, cloud computing and Internet of things in the field of education technology, to a large extent, have changed the teaching mode of new engineering courses and rapidly promoted the reform of higher education. In this paper, the case method and logical empirical evaluation method are used to explore the full and flexible application of artificial intelligence technology means combined with new engineering courses, to create a new engineering intelligent class, and to carry out AI transformation, so as to make education and teaching deeply integrated with AI and develop towards intelligent and efficient development, promote blended teaching and build a deep integrated ecological chain, and form an interactive development mode of sustainable innovation and double helix evolution.
Authors: Li, Yumei

Title: Development of artificial intelligence system for ideological and political education in colleges and universities
Abstract: Today, with the development of the Internet, combining big data with ideological and political education in colleges and universities, building an education system through artificial intelligence technology is an indispensable link. The Agent-based intelligent teaching system is an interactive intelligent teaching system for higher education students. The Agent technology, expert system and.NET technology used in the intelligent system can make the education system more intelligent and closer to teaching practice. Starting from the current development status of the ideological and political education system, this article elaborates on the technology used in the education system, and finally builds an ideological and political education platform, hoping to bring certain reference value to the development and application of the ideological and political education system in colleges and universities.
Authors: Kuang, Min and Cai, Juan and Li, Jing

Title: Design of Artificial Intelligence-based Multimedia Resource Search Service System for Preschool Education
Abstract: Under the conditions of modern society, if preschool educational institutions cannot effectively integrate network resources into the network, their development will be severely restricted. Similarly, if parents cannot effectively guarantee the preschool education resources they want, the preschool education level of the family cannot fully obtain the convenience of information-based education. This paper aims to study the design of artificial intelligence (AI)-based Multimedia Resource (MR) search service system for preschool education. This paper analyzes the overview of AI, the methods of AI algorithms and the impact of AI on education and teaching, and finally analyzes the types of MR. The empirical analysis results show that the performance of the traditional preschool education MR search service system has been greatly improved after the adoption of AI technology, and we conducted a survey and found that more than 81% of people felt that designing a preschool education MR search service system applying artificial intelligence algorithms, it is found that the design efficiency has become higher.
Authors: Jiang, Xi

Title: The Introduction of Artificial Intelligence in the Study of Economic Disciplines in Higher Educational Institutions
Abstract: This article reveals the importance of teaching artificial intelligence and its application in the study of economic disciplines in higher educational institutions. The article reveals the importance of teaching logical programming languages, including the PROLOG language. The novelty of the article lies in the use of simple spreadsheet editors as prototypes of expert systems, as well as building predictive models using the STATISTICA program. Thanks to such software, it is possible to achieve model accuracy in forecasting, building regression analysis, tending to one hundred percent.
Authors: Gulyamov, Saidakhror Saidakhmedovich and Fayziev, Rabim Alikulovich and Rodionov, Andrey Aleksandrovich and Mukhiddinova, Munavvarkhon Khayetovna

Title: The Application of Artificial Intelligence in Public Administration
Abstract: With the continuous improvement of science and technology in China, people put forward higher requirements for public management. Artificial intelligence as a new generation of technology products, how to enter the management level, triggered the discussion of relevant experts. This paper first points out the related concepts of artificial intelligence and public management, then discusses the measures and effects of the combination of the two, and finally provides a solution to the problems caused by the combination of the two.
Authors: Hou, Xihui

Title: Research on School Principals' Willingness to Adopt Artificial Intelligence Education and Related Influencing Factors
Abstract: Artificial intelligence education is an important way to cultivate artificial intelligence talents, which is of great significance to social development. Based on the UTAUT model, we introduce Personal Innovation and Perceived Risk variables to explore the influencing factors of principals' willingness to adopt artificial intelligence education. The results show that: at present, the principals have a high willingness to adopt artificial intelligence education, but the actual development rate is low. Personal Innovation, Facilitating Conditions, Effort Expectancy, Performance Expectancy and Social Influence significantly positively affect the Adoption Intention of principals in artificial intelligence education, and Perceived Risk significantly negatively affect the Adoption Intention of principals. Finally, we put forward corresponding suggestions according to the conclusions, in order to optimize the promotion and implementation effect of artificial intelligence education.
Authors: Hao, Zhaojie and Miao, Enhui and Yan, Manman

Title: Application of Artificial Intelligence in Large-scale International Wushu (Taolu) Events
Abstract: In parallel with China’s high-quality economic development, the country is accelerating its efforts to build an innovative and scientific powerhouse. In 2017, the State Council issued the “New Generation of Artificial Intelligence Development Plan” (Guo Fa [2017] No. 35), proposing a "three-step" strategic goal: the first step is to exceed 150 billion yuan in AI core scale by 2020, driving the scale of related industries to exceed 1 trillion yuan. The second step is to 2025, the core scale of artificial intelligence will exceed 400 billion yuan, driving the scale of related industries more than 5 trillion yuan. The third step is that by 2030, the core size of artificial intelligence will exceed 1 trillion yuan. With the rise of a strong sports nation as a national strategy, the development of the sports event industry has also ushered in a golden period. With good development trends in the internationalization of wushu, under the organization of the International Wushu Federation, there have been large international wushu tournaments such as World Wushu Championships, World Junior Wushu Championships, Taolu World Cup, World Kungfu Championships, etc. In the new era, exploring how to fully optimize these types of events through artificial intelligence technology is conducive to enhancing international friendship, spreading and exchanging Chinese wushu culture, as well as the innovative development of wushu event industry.
Authors: Ke, Yi

Title: Development of a Distance Education Cognitive Technology Based on a Unified Artificial Immune System
Abstract: Current trends in the development of the digital society show the relevance of distance education using innovative artificial intelligence technologies. The need for highly qualified engineering personnel determines the increased role of training students of technical specialties online in higher education institutions. The use of the latest advances in the field of artificial intelligence in education makes it possible to increase the efficiency and quality of student training and optimize the work of teachers with large student flows. The difficulties associated with distance education lie in the need for a differentiated approach to students with different cognitive and psychophysical abilities, social conditions and material and technical base. On the other hand, there are problems with the introduction of these technologies in the educational process and educational programs. The research is devoted to the development of a cognitive technology for distance learning of students of technical specialties using the promising direction of artificial immune systems on the MS Teams platform. It is proposed to use a unified artificial immune system to analyze and predict the efficiency of students' knowledge acquisition, as well as to promptly correct the learning trajectory. The technology has been tested on real data obtained in the process of training students of Kazakh-British Technical University JSC (KBTU).
Authors: Samigulina, Galina and Samigulina, Zarina

Title: Reform Proposal for Higher Education Curricula
Abstract: In this work there is a proposal for the curricula reform in Higher Education, an area in which on one hand research is primarily developed and on the other, knowledge, science and technology are produced, in order to acquire a serious humanitarian dimension, capable of equipping scientists with global knowledge as well as awareness of the critical situation for the humanity, of life, and planet, which involve rapid developments in the major issues we face: nuclear, climate change, biotechnology, and artificial intelligence. This is a measure and an attempt of self-control in the use of scientific achievements which, more than any era in the past, are being developed at an unimaginable speed, without giving enough time to society and humans even to realize the forthcoming changes and the dangers of their reckless use.
Authors: Georgios, Tsirigotis and Anastasios, Karassavoglou

Title: Study of Interpretation Training on the Development of Foreign-Related Pharmaceutical Enterprises from the Perspective of Artificial Intelligence —Taking Rising of Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area
Abstract: With the rapid development of Artificial Intelligence (AI), especially for the progress of foreign-related pharmaceutical enterprises, the demand for English interpreting practitioners is increasing. Based on analysis of the perspective of economic development in the Guangdong-HongKong-Macao Greater Bay Area, the study has discussed the training situation of English interpreting learners of higher education from the perspective of AI, while analyzed characteristics on the learning and training in current English interpreting. Moreover, it also puts forward the suitable teaching strategies for the course of English interpreting in higher education, so as to further meet the rising goals of foreign-related enterprises in the Greater Bay Area.
Authors: Li, Ning

Title: Promoting Digital Campus to Smart Campus Based on Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: In this paper, combined with the problems existing in the current campus and based on the advanced technology of artificial intelligence, we propose a five-tier framework model for building a smart campus, and describe the specific application practice of the framework in detail.
Authors: Cao, Ruixia

Title: Development of Artificial Intelligence Campus and Higher Education Management System Under the Background of Big Data and WSN
Abstract: This article uses "big data" to upgrade traditional majors, promote the co-construction and sharing of digital resources, excellent teachers, and educational data, enhance the information literacy of teachers and students, build smart classrooms and virtual factories, widely use online and offline mixed teaching, and promote the overall trend of informationization. "Smart Campus" is moving forward and is divided into four functional modules: student curriculum management module, information release and communication module, teaching support module, and daily office management module. The higher education management system uses the internationally popular WSN technology.
Authors: Li, Chaoxiong

Title: The Application of Artificial Intelligence in Computer Network Technology
Abstract: Today’s era is an era of rapid development. With the continuous improvement of the national economy, China has higher requirements and standards for the development of Internet information technology. Based on this social context, "artificial intelligence" came into being. Artificial intelligence has also brought unprecedented changes to our lives, enriched the world we live in, and made the application of computer network technology more convenient. The needs of the social masses are also constantly improving, and people begin to pursue a higher quality of life. As a kind of high and new technology, computer network technology gradually appears in our life, closely related to the people’s daily life, and has become an advanced industry in the new era. This paper introduces the application of contemporary artificial intelligence technology in computer network technology, through the discussion of artificial intelligence, analyzes the application of artificial intelligence in classification and identification services, network security, computer network management, and can better understand the application strategy of computer network technology under today’s artificial intelligence.
Authors: Han, Zhihua

Title: Identify High-Priority Barriers to Effective Digital Transformation in Higher Education: A Case Study at Private University in Indonesia
Abstract: Some barriers negatively affect the implementation of digital transformation in higher education institutions. This research aims to investigate these barriers in a particular context: a private university in Indonesia. The barriers diagnostic framework (BDF) has been applied to identify and prioritize barriers. It is determined that ‘Actionable plans based on strategy translation’, ‘The ability to embed ICT into the education system’, and ‘Limitations of institutional policies' have high priority barriers and therefore meet critical concerns in the implementation of digital transformation at the case study. The main contribution of this study is providing empirical evidence on barriers to digital transformation in the higher education sector. More understanding of the high-priority barriers will help the management of higher education to find effective and efficient strategies to manage the resources.
Authors: Aditya, Bayu Rima and Murad, Dina Fitria and Ferdiana, Ridi and Kusumawardani, Sri Suning and Wijanarko, Bambang Dwi

Title: Computer Artificial Intelligence Test System in the Internet Information Age
Abstract: In recent years, due to the advancement of technology in the Internet information age, the use of computer artificial intelligence adaptive testing for evaluation has been rapidly developed. Based on Internet information, the article designs and develops an adaptive test system for multiple types of terminals. In the project selection process, it fully considers some of the existing algorithms' high exposure rate, low utilization rate of the question bank, and content balance, etc., and redesigned it. The project selection engine. Through this system, we can provide support for formative assessment, summative assessment and self-assessment.
Authors: Wu, Donglai and Tang, Shilei

Title: Nurturing Talents in Nanotechnology and Artificial Intelligence With International Education Collaboration: Preparing Students for Success in Modern Engineering
Abstract: Higher education typically falls behind during rapid advancements in modern technologies. More attention needs to be paid to educating the new generation of students to cope with the increasing challenges arising from rapid advancements in microelectronics, computers, and software automation. This article is written to address such challenges and describe some key approaches.
Authors: Lai, Chao-Sung and Sheu, Bing and Lei, Kin Fong and Yang, Hui-Ying and Kao, Shao-Ku

Title: Pilot Study on Concerns of Teachers of Using Artificial Intelligence in Learning and Teaching
Abstract: With prevalent applications of artificial intelligence (AI) in daily lives worldwide, harnessing AI is investigated to learn and teach K-12 contexts. It has drawn much attention from researchers and practitioners in education. Teachers are "gatekeepers" of pedagogical innovations in schools. Thus, this study reports the result of investigating teachers’ concerns about adopting AI in education through the Concern-Based Adoption Model (CBAM). This model is composed of 5 theoretical categories of teachers’ concerns, namely Consequence (C), Evaluation (E), Information (I), Management (M), and Refocusing (R). Participants in this study were 38 Hong Kong high-school teachers who participated in an induction seminar about how AI leverages to support educational activities. The data collection was carried out right after the seminar through a questionnaire-based CBAM survey on the participants’ concerns about adopting AI in practice. The result indicates the concerns of E, I, and M. The study result not only preliminarily helps to provide the bases for future work to address high-school teachers’ needs related to AI in education. It also lays an empirical foundation for conducting a larger-scale study on probing into teachers’ concerns about harnessing this pedagogical innovation in K-12 education.
Authors: Jong, Morris Siu-Yung

Title: The Application of Artificial Intelligence to Security Management at the Context of Higher Education in China
Abstract: In the development process of security information construction in Colleges and universities, with the popularization of modern Internet, virtualization, intelligence and other information technology, as well as the maturing of digital campus and smart campus planning in the next few years, it will provide the best information technology selection and favorable infrastructure guarantee for the implementation of security monitoring management system in colleges and universities in the new era. The purpose of this paper is to design an intelligent management system for university security through in-depth study of the role of artificial intelligence in university security management so as to improve the ability of university security. This paper mainly applies SOA and J2EE technology, based on SOA and J2EE server and mobile client, aiming at the main hidden dangers of the current campus security, designs and implements a campus security intelligent management system, which includes four functions: daily office, hidden danger management, evaluation management and security information management. Among them, daily office design includes resource sharing, notice and announcement. Hidden danger management design includes hidden danger supervision, hidden danger statistics and uncorrected hidden danger inquiry. Evaluation management includes evaluation score entry, subordinate unit evaluation and annual ranking management. Safety information management includes safety information browsing, safety information query and safety information statistics. Finally, after the system debugging, the error of each module test is 0, the system can achieve the required functions and effectively improve the campus security management.
Authors: Ma, Ning and Yang, Jie

Title: Building Literacy, Numeration, and Entrepreneurial Mindset Assessments for Indonesian Students through Artificial Intelligence Website
Abstract: Education is basically a system to achieve happiness and prosperity for all people. Quality education actually reflects a society that is advanced, peaceful, and produces constructive traits. For Indonesian students, this insight can be achieved when they have minimum competencies, namely Literacy, Numeracy, and Entrepreneurial Mindset skills which are then abbreviated as (LINE). This research focuses on building a Minimum Competency Mapping System website, then it is named “Assessment of Literacy, Numeracy and Entrepreneurial Mindset which is abbreviated as (LINE Assessment) Indonesian Students based on artificial intelligence”. The research method used is the Neuroresearch method which consists of three stages, namely exploratory research, explanatory research and confirmatory research. For website development using Agile Development Method. The result of the research is the design of the LINE Assessment website based on artificial intelligence.
Authors: Sasmoko and Indrianti, Yasinta and Hermanus, Davy Ronald and Moniaga, Jurike and Edgardo, Benaya Nusantara

Title: Educational Service Platform for Artificial Intelligence Resources
Abstract: The Educational service platform developed in the project "Research on AI- and Simulation-Based Engineering at Exascale" (RAISE)* is presented. The platform contains RAISE’s educational resource portfolio focusing on Artificial Intelligence linked also to its application on High-Performance Computers. The online Educational services platform contains information on forthcoming training events and information on diverse learning resources. The structure and choice of the elements and the employed technologies and the design of the platform are described. In addition, the portfolio development process is elaborated. Information on degree programs, separate courses on Artificial Intelligence and other domain-specific and interdisciplinary educational resources from the project partners, and from other projects and educational resource providers are collected on the platform.
Authors: Slaidins, Ilmars and Timrote, Ieva and Zagorskis, Viktors and Cikovskis, Lauris

Title: Curriculum Design of Artificial Intelligence in Middle School - Taking Posture Recognition as an Example
Abstract: At present, there is still a lack of suitable artificial intelligence curriculum in primary and secondary schools in China. Based on a project-based learning model, an artificial intelligence course was designed for middle school-aged students. Learning objectives were deconstructed according to the five concepts of artificial intelligence, and learning contents were arranged according to the cognitive characteristics of middle school students. In the process of teaching, the cultivation of students' computational thinking ability was paid great attention, and teaching example was given at the end of the paper.
Authors: Deng, Wei and Huang, Xinglei and Liu, Qingtang and Wang, Zhibin

Title: Research on Cultivating New Teachers’ Literacy Based on Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: With the development of science and technology, artificial intelligence began to integrate into all aspects of people's lives, and began to have an important impact on the lives of residents. The main characteristics of artificial intelligence include from artificial knowledge expression to big data-driven knowledge learning technology, from classified processing multimedia data to cross-media learning, from the pursuit of intelligent machines to high-level man-machine, brain-computer interaction and fusion, from focusing on individual intelligence to intelligent groups based on the Internet and big data, so teachers need to improve their professional literacy and core literacy through role remodeling in the era of artificial intelligence, and at the same time learn more professional knowledge and solid skills based on the nature and characteristics of education. In specific teaching and classrooms, the application of artificial intelligence should be gradually popularized. In the flexible human-computer interaction, the power of artificial intelligence technology to promote the growth of human life is maximized. It can provide students with a better and more suitable teaching path for individualized development. This article aims to explore the research on teacher literacy cultivation in the era of artificial intelligence as follows.
Authors: Daxing, Teng

Title: Research on the Design of Lexical-chunks Centered Mode of Writing under Artificial Intelligence in College English Course
Abstract: In the era of big data and artificial intelligence, English learning resources have become more abundant, and the ways for students to obtain English learning resources have become more convenient, which has prompted changes in the traditional teacher-centered English model. More and more higher education institutions and scholars focus on cultivating students' autonomous English learning abilities and advocate a student-oriented English teaching model. This paper designs a college English writing teaching model based on big data technology to highlight the teaching focus of lexical chunks. The research found that big data technology effectively monitors the learning process of students and gives timely feedback on the learning effect. At the same time, the teaching of lexical chunk promotes students' writing input and triggers output, which may innovate English teaching and motivate students' learning motivation. Through the comparison with the study of computational linguistics, it is also found that students' understanding of lexical chunk is basic, and it is reasonable to infer that students can not fully grasp the lexical chunks used in the daily communication in terms of the proper forms and the pragmatic functions, and misusing happens fairly frequently. The study highlights the significance of integrating the teaching mode which involves lexical chunk specifically in English textbooks and lectures for EFL, especially for students with a relatively low language proficiency.
Authors: CUI, YAN

Title: Case Study on Application of Artificial Intelligence to Oral English Teaching in Vocational Colleges
Abstract: The intelligent education represented by artificial intelligence technology provides a breakthrough and a new revolution in English teaching as it carries out accurate teaching, constructs intelligent learning network space and solves the dilemma of "spending more time but achieving little effect". With the increasing demand for students in higher vocational colleges to speak English, the FIF oral English platform is tested to carry out an experimental study. Based on a comparative analysis of experimental and controlled classes, the effectiveness of AI is studied in promoting English listening and speaking teaching to boost the deep integration of AI and English teaching in higher vocational Colleges.
Authors: Wu, Liyun

Title: Artificial Intelligence Technology Supports the Following Research on the Generation of Subtitles for College English Teaching
Abstract: In the process of college English teaching, the generation of subtitles in English class has gradually received more attention. The accuracy of subtitle generation determines the quality of English teaching. In order to optimize the subtitle generation technology for English teaching in university classrooms, this study uses the self attention mechanism of artificial intelligence technology to construct the subtitle generation model, and applies it to the sequence segmentation and paragraph segmentation of news data set. The results show that the subtitle generation model based on self attention mechanism can effectively complete the corresponding tasks with high accuracy, recall and FI-Score, and provide strong support for English teaching.
Authors: Zuo, Guangming and Qiu, Yingying

Title: The Construction of a Mixed University English Teaching System Based on Artificial Intelligence Technology
Abstract: Artificial intelligence technology is widely used in English teaching, the application of artificial intelligence technology in the English teaching mainly adopts data real-time monitoring, data acquisition, data mining and other auxiliary English model system, auxiliary system of artificial intelligence application in English on the experiment platform are mainly composed of data acquisition, on the experimental platform for data integration analysis of English. The English experiment platform system has the characteristics of wide data range, large computation and high complexity. This paper mainly studies the practical role of artificial intelligence in college English teaching and discusses the application of artificial intelligence in English teaching. At the same time, through the systematic analysis of the current AI-assisted language learning software and system defects put forward relevant solutions, artificial intelligence technology is conducive to improve the application of intelligent human-machine system in English teaching, and provide technical support for the cultivation and development of English talents in colleges and universities.
Authors: Fan, Liangliang and Yang, Wei

Title: Application of Artificial Intelligence in Clinical Diagnosis of Children with Autism Spectrum Disorders
Abstract: In recent years, the incidence of autism spectrum disorder has been increasing, traditional diagnostic tools such as the autism diagnostic observation scale - revised”, “the autism diagnostic interview scale”, and intervention measures such as applied behavior analysis, structured education, social story has been applied to clinical, but the early accurate diagnosis and treatment of ASD still faces various challenges. With the development of computer technology, electronic engineering, statistics and other disciplines, clinical medicine has entered the era of intelligence. The application of artificial intelligence in the medical field provides broad prospects for the timeliness and accuracy of ASD diagnosis and the improvement of its core symptoms. The problems of ASD rehabilitation caused by insufficient medical resources and high treatment costs are expected to be solved by the intervention of artificial intelligence. Artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming more and more prominent in the efficient, high-precision and high-stability clinical diagnosis of autism. This paper reviews the literature in recent years, and discusses the prediction, early recognition and diagnosis of autism, as well as the research on auxiliary intervention.
Authors: Sun, Furong and Zhao, Xinyuan and Huo, Lijiao

Title: E-Commerce Assistance with a Smart Chatbot using Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: In this present research we use design science analysis to express chatbot design awareness in higher education. For previous research into the design process, we carried out a literature review. Furthermore, we studied the content of student emails and forum articles from four instances of a fundamental Java programming course. We introduce a conceptual architecture for chatbots in higher education from literature and evidence and show how this is applied. We conclude with a debate with tentative design recommendations and a plan for further research. Chatbot rules-based program performs prefixed acts based on "playbooks" that you have setup at the back of the user interface. Just like a virtual assistant, chat-based rules-based technologies can function on the basis of click acts, such as "Yes" against "No."Website and social networking outlets have become more and more popular places for people to voice their opinions on different issues, in particular their frustrations with brands and corporations.
Authors: Rakhra, Manik and Gopinadh, Gurram and Addepalli, Narasimha Sai and Singh, Gurasis and Aliraja, Shaik and Reddy, Vennapusa Siva Ganeshwar and Reddy, Muthumula Navaneeswar

Title: Research on Practice Evaluation System of Higher Vocational Preschool Education Based on Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: To improve the quality of practical teaching and promote the synchronization of practical teaching and practice, the theory of artificial intelligence network is introduced into the evaluation of practical teaching quality, and the relevant mathematical model is established. Firstly, a perfect practical teaching evaluation index system is provided, and the related index system and quality standard are established. Then, when the convergence speed of BP algorithm training network is slow, genetic algorithm is used to optimize the operation parameters of the network, the optimization results are taken as the initial value of BP algorithm, and BP algorithm is used to train the network until the required accuracy is reached. Finally, by using data cleaning, network training and rationalization test, a more reasonable result is obtained, which provides a new idea for teaching quality evaluation.
Authors: Huimin, Liu

Title: Benefits of Organizing Remote Education in the Design of a University's Unified Information and Analytical Space Using Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: The study aims to substantiate the importance of using a UIAS of the university for organizing remote education. The creation of a UIAS allows organizing accounting, storage and accessing the data collected in the course of the work of the structural divisions of the university online. It helps consolidating the date which is relevant and important for generating reports and analytical documentation of divisions when organizing remote education.
Authors: Gallini, Nadezhda I. and Gorbunova, Nataliya V. and Popov, Maksim N. and Chetyrbok, Petr V. and Koykova, Elzara I.

Title: The Trajectory of Artificial Intelligence Research in Higher Education: A Bibliometric Analysis and Visualisation
Abstract: The rapid development of artificial intelligence (AI) and its applications is gaining global attention and promises to revolutionise every aspect of human life, including education. AI will transform higher education (HE) institutions through improved adaptation and competitiveness. The application of AI in HE is an emerging research area with limited review. Our paper seeks to provide a comprehensive bibliometric analysis and visualisation of research on AI application in HE in the past two decades. We evaluated 283 articles published by researchers from 59 countries in the Scopus database over the past two decades based on explicit inclusion and exclusion criteria. The study applied various bibliometric indicators and word analysis to examine emergent trends. VOSviewer was used for visualisations to map a knowledge base by uncovering keywords used within AI in HE. The results show the number of AI articles published per year, their geographic distribution, analysis by subject area and keywords, and research trends. Research in AI is interdisciplinary, dominated by computer science and engineering fields. AI research in HE is growing, the first 15 years contributed 22%, and the last five years yielded 78%. Countries with a high investment in research dominated AI research, with China and the United States leading. There is very little research from developing countries. Our paper highlights current and future research directions in AI in education, and its limitations.
Authors: Maphosa, Vusumuzi and Maphosa, Mfowabo

Title: A computer assisted training system based on artificial intelligence and virtual reality technology
Abstract: Artificial intelligence technology is being applied to all fields of society at an unprecedented speed with the development of various high and new technologies.Colleges and universities must always be well prepared to meet the educational revolution brought by artificial intelligence with various advanced technologies to achieve high-quality personnel training and social services.A collages and universities personnel training system based on artificial intelligence technology is proposed in this paper after the in-depth study of the history of artificial intelligence and its application problems that may occur in higher education activities with artificial intelligence system in the future.
Authors: Zhan, Wang and Guangzhi, Dong and Xinglai, Ba

Title: Application of Artificial Intelligence Technology in College Students' Foreign Language Learning
Abstract: Based on the introduction of Artificial Intelligence, collation, and summary of the current situation of Chinese College English Education, this study points out AI technology has much potential in education. Therefore, how to make excellent use of it appears as a fundamental issue among Chinses scholars. It is suggested that Chinese college students’ English learning is achieved by means of AI in 3 perspectives, namely as an intelligent teacher, an emotional soother, and a rater to reach the goal of developing college students' multiple intelligences under the current high-speed economic and social background.
Authors: Deng, Min

Title: The View of Intelligence Technology in the Learning Sector
Abstract: Artificial intelligence is its ability to carry out all the tasks that the human mind carries out that are based on a scientific and experimental basis. Artificial intelligence is one of the most important technological breakthroughs that have been developed to simulate the human mind, as it can solve the most difficult problems, mind-based games, and are difficult to solve. The educational process is constantly searching for modern methods, methods and strategies, higher education, like other fields, is looking for its developed electronic and technological version by using artificial intelligence technology, which is the technology of the era, considering that it touches all Life fields. It plays an important role in all aspects of our lives, from making, health, and education. It is considered one of the most important branches of computer science, but it was developed to formulate it for the world and it carries out tasks that are difficult for humans to implement at the same speed that is done by Robert.
Authors: AlFarsi, Ghaliya and Yusof, Azmi Bin Mohd. and Tawafak, Ragad M and Malik, Sohail Iqbal and Mathew, Roy

Title: Research on Classroom Teaching Management and Process Evaluation Based on Artificial Intelligence
Abstract: Artificial intelligence technology has been widely used in various fields. Artificial intelligence technology is applied to higher vocational classroom scenes, and intelligent technology is used to accelerate the reform of classroom management, talent training models and teaching methods. This article first analyzes the current status of classroom attendance and teaching evaluation, and then realizes classroom intelligent attendance based on face recognition technology. Next, the students' behavior status is divided, and the students' classroom behavior recognition is realized through YOLO-v3, and finally the classroom teaching process evaluation is realized.
Authors: Gao, Qiang and Pan, Jun and Hong, Ruifeng and Li, Weiqun

Title: Here to Stay After the Pandemic: Sentiment Analysis of Higher Education Teachers at UNAM
Abstract: In order to continue teaching during the Covid-19 pandemic, teachers around the world were forced to move their courses online without prior notice, learn digital technologies quickly, and adapt their teaching practices to this new environment. In this research project, we analyzed 244 comments posted in a collaborative wall by teachers at a university regarding the changes that are here to stay. Using four artificial intelligence algorithms, we estimated and classified the sentiments and emotions expressed in the texts; we also identified the themes that were mentioned by teachers with a qualitative methodology, thematic analysis. Findings showed that positive and neutral feelings towards the changes prevailed among teachers, and that comments were centered on facts more than opinions. The predominant emotion was confidence, followed by anticipation, joy and sadness. It was also evident that they envision technological changes in their teaching practice, but that they are also considering an impact on their pedagogy as well as in their attitudes towards education and life, and in their relationships with students.
Authors: González-Flores, Patricia and Maya, Cinthia Rodríguez and Sierra, Irma Rocío Zavala

Title: Principles of Robotization in Education
Abstract: The following is considered, the application of robotics in the education system and artificial intelligence. The special role of AI in robotics is noted. The goals and objectives of the project are indicated: "Robotization in the Higher Education System."
